name: Blur
performed
a
surprise
gig
in
London
last
night
–
here’s
what
happened
content: The band reunited at Albarn's 'Africa Express' gig Blur surprised fans in East London last night as they reunited for a performance at Damon Albarn’s ‘Africa Express: The Circus’ gig.Albarn was joined on stage with Dave Rowntree, Alex James and Graham Coxon; the group performed ‘Tender’, ‘Clover Over Dover’ and ‘Song 2’. It was the first time ‘Clover Over Dover’ had been performed live.The band came onto stage at around 10:30 during Albarn’s ‘Africa Express’ gig which brings together musicians from around the globe.The shows, which have run since 2006, are known for the long length and surprise guests. Previous performers at the show include Paul McCartney, Paul Weller and Johnny Marr alongside famed African musicians including Baaba Maal, Oumou Sangaré and Fatoumata Diawara.Blur were accompanied by the London Community Gospel Choir and Rokia Traoré for ‘Tender’.You can see videos, images and more reaction to the gig here:
